intro: Gnaphalium saturejoides var. laxa, commonly known as the slender swamp thistle, is a flowering plant native to wetland and marshy environments in North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright, hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves with serrated edges. Its flowers are yellowish-green, arranged in dense clusters, and produce small, wind-dispersed seeds. This variant is distinguished by its more loosely spaced inflorescences compared to other varieties within the species.
